intro: Rubus moluccanus var. hakonensis, commonly known as the Hakonensis blackberry, is a variant of the blackberry plant native to Japan. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, dark purple to black berries that are typically harvested in late summer. It thrives in temperate climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and valuable species within the Rubus genus.
